alert.note: Alert for Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 8:29AM CDT until further notice by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Lavaca. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hallettsville, Ezzell, Sublime, Speaks, Vienna, Vsetin, Breslau and Moravia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
